fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
I am creating a feature request. We would like our commercial plugin (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/8965) to be bundled with JIRA Studio. I have already created a support ticket to get access to a user with admin access in the Studio Testing environment (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-15130). I guess I first need to verify that the plugin works in the test environment and then come back here and update this feature request.
fields.summary: Bundle the frevvo Live Forms and Workflows plugin with JIRA Studio

In standalone JIRA this is trivial, but totally impossible in Studio. It'd be very nice to have the ability to make these same customisations in the GUI.

fields.description:
The class FisheyePluginManagerFactory is pretty much copied in its entirety into Studio in order to make the osgiContainerManager available to FisheyeInitialData. We should find a nicer solution to this (probably involving changes in Fisheye).

Ideally, fisheye should put osgiContainerManager into its spring context to make it consistent with the other applications.

fields.description:
The initial migration of the studio initial data code (AOD-3474) predominantly focused on getting the studio-3.0-dev branch up and running with initial data. Large sections of code were copied without too much thought about streamlining and refactoring.

Once things are working, we need to refactor and streamline the code where possible. Quite a few suggestions for this have already been put forth in CR-AOD-374.
fields.summary: Streamline and Refactor Initial Data Code

fields.description: When a user sign up for JIRA Studio, the user will be set as a Collaborator. If the license is not entitled for any Collaborators, this will cause problem. JIRA will stop allowing issue creation until the problem is fixed.
fields.summary: Default Account Type should be determined based on license

fields.description:
It's not obvious how user can change the access level from No Access to Developer or Collaborator. 

Possible ideas for improvement:

Documentation:
[here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Managing+User+Access+Levels], [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Licensing] and [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Managing+User+Access+Levels+in+JIRA+Studio]. Add information that user needs to be member of *users* group to access the Studio. Explain that deactivated user is the same as user with No Access. Add the information from [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=224397803] to the previous three links. 
 
UI:
- On user details page change "Edit details" link to "Edit details and Access Level"
- On user details page there is a row: "Access Level: Developer" - make it link to "Edit details" page
- On Edit details page where there is a dropdown (collaborator, developer) add a "No access" option
fields.summary: Improve understanding and management of User Access Level

fields.description:
I've seen a couple of cases now where Bamboo has no outgoing email server configured, thereby preventing email notifications from being configured or sent out.

In one case the outgoing email server definitely used to be present. Unfortunately I don't yet have a clue as to what might me causing this.
fields.summary: Bamboo loses its outgoing email server

fields.description:
Please bundle the Timesheet Report and Portlet plugin with JIRA.
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/294

It includes some Timesheet reports that we require for our resource/capacity tracking.
fields.summary: Bundle the Timesheet Report and Portlet plugin with JIRA

fields.description: When the SVN commit hook "Require JIRA issue key for a successful commit" is enabled, branching and tagging operations are also blocked when a JIRA key is not referenced.
fields.summary: Branching and Tagging Operations Should Not Requiring JIRA Issue Key

fields.description:
JIRA should allow the users to view multiple filtered list on the same browser.

Steps to reproduce:
1. log into JIRA
2. create a filter and go to the list
3. view an item on that list.
4. on the same broswer, in another tab, create another filter and open an item on this list.
5. go back to the first filtered list, and click on the link 'Return to search'

Expected behavior: I expected it would take me back to my first filtered list.
Actual behavior: JIRA took me to the 2nd filtered list that I recently opened in a new tab.
fields.summary: can't view 2 filters on the same browser

fields.description:
Steps:
Administration 
Choose a project
Edit project
Click on Project Avatar
Click on the "x" right top of the project avatar image.

Result:
Page shows white screens and nothing happens

Expected:
The Project Avatar image to be deleted
fields.summary: Project Avatar: When trying to delete a custom avatar the page freezes in a white screen.

fields.description:
Hi all,
I have a feature request for the WebDav directory of JIRA Studio.
The request is that a special group is introduced. Users that belong to this group can only access the WebDav directory.
It would even be better if it would be confiugurable dynamically, as in case of SVN.
Scenario
The scenario I am facing:
I have requested the setup of a daily backup of our JIRA Studio instance. This works perfectly. But the backup is placed within the WebDav directory. Only users with the role administrator have access to this WebDav. 
The backup should be picked up by our backup solution. So, I don't want to give an administrator user to the backup-team just to retrieve the backup.
They shall get a user just for accessing the backup directory within WebDav.

I already posted this on https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-14850.

Regards,
Florian
fields.summary: Special Access Rights for WebDav

fields.description:
Since the upgrade, the Jira Studio navignation toolbar at the footer overlays the footer links (Request Support, Log a Bug, Terms of Use, etc, etc)

Using Firebug, the div with id="poweredby" as a sub-div of div class="footer" can be seen, but cannot access the links (on a slow connection, i can see the links briefly before the toolbar overlays the links).
fields.summary: Google Apps Activity Bar overlays footer links

fields.description:
When I've been gathering thread dumps of the applications, I often see that there are usually at least 10 quartz work threads.

Is this necessary?  Would it be possible to cut this pool down to say 1 idle workers by default and only spin up more in need be?
fields.summary: quartzScheduler_Worker-[1-9] threads

[INFO]    fingerprint to validate the certificate manually!

[INFO]  - Valid: from Tue Jan 04 11:00:00 EST 2011 until Tue Jan 28 10:59:59 EST 2014
[INFO]  - Issuer: CN=DigiCert High Assurance CA-3, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US

{noformat}
fields.summary: labs.atlassian.com does not have a trusted certificate

fields.description:
Scenario: Two JIRA projects linked to the same FishEye repo

Steps to reproduce:
* Create a project in JIRA with the key JRA1
* Create a project in JIRA with the key JRA2
* Change the FishEye key of the project JRA2 to JRA1
*this way, both projects will use the same FishEye repo (JRA1)*

Now
# Click on Issues and select JRA2
# Clink on Source
# Go back to Issues

The problem is that from Source to Issues tab, FishEye will send you to the JRA1 project, not to JRA2 (where you came from).

It means that from FishEye perspective, it's only linked to on JIRA project.
fields.summary: Improve tab navigation when having the same FishEye repo linked for multiple JIRA projects

fields.description:
Automated deployment tools (e.g. [Capistrano|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capistrano]) need to access Studio's SVN repo to export the code and deploy it to servers.

Currently, the only way for customers to access a protected repo is with the credentials of a Developer user account. These credentials are too private to put into a common deployment configuration file, and it's expensive to purchase additional Developer accounts just for the purpose of having read-only access to a part of the Subversion repository.

It would be good to have the ability to create read-only SVN user accounts whose permissions can be configured (e.g. to restrict access to a single project) without the additional cost of Developer licences.
fields.summary: Provide read-only SVN user accounts for deployment purposes
Gapps doesn't load properly due to UserService being unavailable

fields.description:
Page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=180289817

It would be nice if we can add a precaution about apps' server base URL. For instance, we should mention that Confluence in JIRA Studio has server base URL of a pattern http://domain.jira.com/wiki.

This may help to avoid future issues like [AOD-14627|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-14627] from happening.
fields.summary: Update documentation to include server base URL

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Customer request for supporting the Structure plugin:

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/34717
fields.summary: Request to support Structure plugin

fields.description:
The timeouts appear to be consistent over 5 builds since https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-NONGAPPS-FFWDRV-98. It's not clear that the failures are related to that change - needs investigating.

See https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-NONGAPPS-FFWDRV/test.
fields.summary: Build break: SmokeTest.testCommitHook() and SmokeTest.testCreateIssue() consistently timing out in build

fields.description: AOD-3502 requires a new version of Crowd. Do a timeboxed investigation into obstacles thrown up by upgrading to 2.1.x.
fields.summary: Spike upgrade to Crowd 2.1
Bundle Zendesk plugin

fields.description:
If I write some R code in a code tag, like
{code}
# assign this variable
r1 <- c(1,2,3)
r2 <- c(4,5,6)
{code}
the r1 and r2 are being replaced with tokX-inline-tok.

See http://kinetic.jira.com/browse/MAIN-826?focusedCommentId=14615&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#action_14615

Thanks,
Nimrod
fields.summary: Incorrect replacements occur within code tags

fields.description: The balsamiq and gliffy plugins use a web item condition that checks that the attachments path is set.  Due to changes in the attachment path and the upgrade associated task, this property was not set.  This meant the menu item was not displayed.
fields.summary: Menu items for Attachment based plugins not visible
Add an upgrade task to change existing instances to using the default directories for attachments and indexes

fields.description:
https://studio.atlassian.com/builds/browse/STRM-TRUNK/log

I've tried stopping the build, canceling the build, disabling the build, stopping the agent, and disabling the agent. Even when the agent was disabled, the agent reported as being "Idle" yet STRM-TRUNK-637 kept on chugging along. Please kill the build, or let me know what I can do to kill it myself. Thanks
fields.summary: STRM-TRUNK-637 is stuck building

fields.description: Stac, spac, labs(?), plus the free instances, and the opt-in installations.  Check page.
fields.summary: Update Pre-Release Studio Instances

fields.description: We're trying to add tests in the STRM project that use the new Atlassian Selenium library.  On headless machines AMPS uses Xvfb to fake an X Window system.  Can we get xvfb added to the images running on StAC?  Otherwise we'll need to run our UI tests elsewhere. We'd rather have all our builds under one roof, but if we have to have them elsewhere let us know.
fields.summary: Add xvfb support to agents on StAC

fields.description:
Suggestion put forth by Fabian as part of CR-AOD-351.

See https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/UPM/trunk/plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/upm/impl/NamespacedPluginSettings.java?r=HEAD
fields.summary: Use UPM NamespacedPluginSettings to namespace theme mode and app status variables stored in plugin settings

fields.description:
The main things I can think of are:
 * User should have the ability to use the standard, bundled Confluence themes (although we will make no attempt to provide navigation aids to other applications if the user chooses a theme other than the 'Tabbed Navigation Theme')
 * User should be able to use the standard Confluence admin
fields.summary: As a Jira On Demand user who has also purchased Confluence On Demand, I would like to have feature parity with Confluence On Demand standalone

fields.description: Add their plugin keys to user-installed-plugins.properties in the studio-theme-confluence-plugin module/bundle.
fields.summary: Make sure all bundled third-party plugins are configured as "User-installed Plugins" in Confluence

fields.description: A lot of customers do not use these directories in their project layout so we should not require it. We already require that their repo be re-organised into top-level directories matching Studio's projects, which is already quite an ask for a lot of them.
fields.summary: SVN-Importer: Do not require that top-level directories contain trunk, tags and branches sub-directories
